text: Kava is a plant of the pepper family. It comes from Polynesia and other lands in the Pacific Islands. The roots of the plant are used to make a drink with sedative and anesthetic properties. Kava is used in many cultures in the Pacific Ocean, besides its native Polynesia. These include Hawaii, Vanuatu, Melanesia and some parts of Micronesia. Kava can relieve pain and make people calm. It is usually taken as a drug to relax without losing mental clarity in thinking and remembering. Evidence collected in studies show Kava is likely more effective than a placebo at helping calm some mild anxiety. == References == ==Other websites== Category:Medicinal plants Category:Opioids Category:Piperales
title: Kava
